para.sentence: If |x|<1 , then the quotient x^{n}/(1-x^{n}) is the sum of a geometric series, and when the series (27.7.1) converges absolutely it can be rearranged as a power series: \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}f(n)\frac{x^{n}}{1-x^{n}}=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\sum_{d \mathbin{|}n}f(d)x^{n}.

Again with |x|<1 , special cases of (27.7.2) include: \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\mu\left(n\right)\frac{x^{n}}{1-x^{n}}=x, , \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\phi\left(n\right)\frac{x^{n}}{1-x^{n}}=\frac{x}{(1-x)^{2}}, , \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}n^{\alpha}\frac{x^{n}}{1-x^{n}}=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\sigma_{ \alpha}\left(n\right)x^{n}, , \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\lambda\left(n\right)\frac{x^{n}}{1-x^{n}}=\sum_{n=1}^{ \infty}x^{n^{2}}.
